vista.set
Class IndexedDataSet

java.lang.Object
  vista.set.IndexedDataSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, DataSet, Named
public class IndexedDataSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataSet

An indexed data set does not need to store all its x values. X values are the indicies for the y values. All that is needed in such a regular indexed array is to store initial and final values of x and the step size.

Version:
$Id: IndexedDataSet.java,v 1.4 2001/03/05 21:20:08 eli2 Exp $
Author:
Nicky Sandhu (DWR).
See Also:
DataSetElement, DataSetIterator, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

IndexedDataSet

public IndexedDataSet(java.lang.String name,
                      double xInitial,
                      double xFinal,
                      double step,
                      double[] y)
Initializes a data set with the initial x and final x values and the x step size and y arrays. No new memory is created, only references are held to the two arrays.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x and y array lengths don't match.

IndexedDataSet

public IndexedDataSet(java.lang.String name,
                      double xInitial,
                      double xFinal,
                      double step,
                      double[] y,
                      int[] flags)
Initializes a data set with the y arrays and with a flag array for each value. No new memory is created, only references are held to the two arrays.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x and y array lengths don't match.

IndexedDataSet

                      DataSetAttr attr)
Initializes a data set with the y arrays and with a flag array for each value. No new memory is created, only references are held to the two arrays.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x and y array lengths don't match.
